subject: Proximus Rebrands International Division as Proximus Global
overview: Proximus has rebranded its international division, integrating BICS, Telesign, and Route Mobile under the new name Proximus Global. This new entity is valued at approximately €3.1 billion in equity. The move aims to streamline operations, harmonize roles, and drive commercial growth by leveraging the group's diverse talent and global presence. Clear Bridge Ventures, the investment vehicle of Route Mobile's founders, will retain an 8.7% stake in Proximus Global, with Proximus owning the rest. The rebranding is part of Proximus's strategy to tap into higher-growth opportunities in the international market.

subject: Scarlet Offers More Data at Same Price
overview: Scarlet, a subsidiary of Proximus, has increased the data volumes on its mobile plans at no extra cost, starting in 2025. This initiative provides customers with more data while maintaining the same advantageous pricing.

subject: Proximus Tests Cargo Sailboat in Supply Chain
overview: Proximus is exploring sustainable transportation methods by testing a cargo sailboat in its supply chain, in collaboration with Sagemcom. This initiative highlights Proximus's commitment to environmental responsibility.

subject: Proximus Fiber Network Outperforms Competition
overview: Studies by nPerf and Ookla have recognized Proximus's fiber network for its superior speed and performance compared to competitors. These recognitions highlight the quality and reliability of Proximus's fiber infrastructure.

subject: Proximus Global Aims for Growth
overview: Proximus is focusing on global growth by integrating BICS, Telesign, and Route Mobile into Proximus Global. This move contrasts with other incumbents who are focusing on their home markets. Proximus aims to create a global leader in digital communications through this integration.

subject: Proximus Sells Luxembourg Towers
overview: Proximus has sold its mobile tower assets in Luxembourg to InfraRed Capital Partners for approximately €108 million. This sale is part of Proximus's asset divestment plan.

subject: Proximus to Sell Be-Mobile
overview: Proximus is reportedly planning to sell its mobility subsidiary, Be-Mobile, to fund its fiber optic cable rollout. Be-Mobile is known for its parking payment system via text message. Proximus owns a majority stake in the company and is looking to free up funds for fiber investments.

subject: Proximus Shareholding Transparency Declaration
overview: Proximus has issued multiple transparency declarations regarding its shareholding, indicating ongoing changes and updates in its ownership structure.

subject: Proximus Global Organizational Structure
overview: Proximus Global will have a simplified organizational structure with a unified global leadership team. Guillaume Boutin will serve as CEO of Proximus Global while continuing as group CEO. The integration of BICS, Telesign, and Route Mobile aims to streamline operations and governance.

subject: Proximus and Microsoft Strategic Partnership
overview: Proximus and Microsoft have announced a 5-year strategic partnership to enhance cloud and AI solutions. This collaboration will allow both companies to leverage their expertise and product leadership, with Microsoft strengthening its use of Proximus's CPaaS & DI product suites.

subject: Infosys and Proximus Strengthen Collaboration
overview: Infosys and Proximus Group have announced a strategic collaboration to unlock new business opportunities. This partnership aims to leverage the strengths of both companies in digital services and communication solutions.
